topics.title: Planning conservatively with milestone-based unlocks
topics.summary: Sahil explains how to plan in low-visibility conditions: set a conservative annual plan, then use short-term milestones to unlock additional spend or growth if targets are hit, avoiding whiplash and optimism bias.

topics.title: Introduction and Background
topics.summary: Lenny introduces Sahil Mansuri and the episode’s focus: how founders should adjust sales during a downturn (quotas, comp, forecasting, retention, and sales technique).

topics.title: Sponsor Break
topics.summary: Ads for Flatfile (data onboarding/CSV import) and Merge (unified API for integrations).

topics.title: Sahil’s sales career and Bravado overview
topics.summary: Sahil shares his sales background (starting in 2008, selling through the 2009 recession, major enterprise wins at Glassdoor) and explains Bravado’s sales community and products.

topics.title: Bravado War Room and real-time market pulse
topics.summary: They discuss Bravado’s War Room concept (Stack Overflow for sales) and how it provides real-time insight into quota attainment, industries, and company performance; Lenny discloses he’s a small investor.

topics.title: Why sales strategy must change in downturns
topics.summary: Sahil contrasts boom-time sales playbooks with recession realities: capital is expensive, pipeline is harder, and companies must prioritize unit economics, retention, and expansion over pure new-logo growth.

topics.title: Quota attainment data and forecasting approach
topics.summary: Sahil shares Bravado data showing rapidly worsening quota attainment (reps and companies missing targets) and recommends conservative annual forecasts with pre-agreed checkpoints to reforecast and adjust spend.

topics.title: Uncertainty, recession comparisons, and being wrong often
topics.summary: They discuss how this downturn differs from COVID, why many leaders haven’t experienced volatility like this, and why teams must get comfortable reforecasting and updating decisions without stigma.

topics.title: How Bravado collects quota benchmarks
topics.summary: Sahil explains Bravado’s “gift-to-get” model: reps enter performance data to receive benchmarks and leaderboards; Lenny asks how listeners can join.

topics.title: Rethinking sales comp plans for retention
topics.summary: Sahil breaks down typical SaaS comp (OTE, quota ratios, accelerators) and argues it over-rewards short-term new bookings while ignoring churn; he advocates aligning incentives with renewals, retention, and customer outcomes.

topics.title: Why comp plans don’t innovate and short-termism
topics.summary: They explore why comp plans stay outdated: low transparency, executive whims, copy-paste leadership patterns, and founders’ preference for short-term revenue spikes; Sahil ties this to building durable businesses customers love.

topics.title: Sponsor Break
topics.summary: Ad for Miro (collaborative online whiteboard for product strategy, research, roadmaps, and design workflows).

topics.title: Retention-first: shift top sellers to customer success
topics.summary: Sahil argues outbound response rates are down and sales cycles are longer, so companies should prioritize keeping existing customers—potentially moving top AEs into customer success to prevent churn and drive expansion.

topics.title: Become a value-added advisor with customer benchmarks
topics.summary: He recommends using vendor-wide visibility to help customers survive (benchmarks, playbooks, insights) and reframing content from lead-gen to retention; Sahil shares how Bravado offers market insights to retain clients as hiring slows.
